CatDescriptText: Miss Audrey Harrington, 2335 Centre Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 10, 1958, pg. A2, with question: "Do you think that Negroes display any racial prejudice towards each other?"  Answer reads: "Some do, but the majority does not. You see prejudice displayed sometimes when one person has something better than another.  The other gets mad and starts talking about the person who has it."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Audrey Harrington holding books and standing on Liberty Avenue in front of Jenkins Arcade, with Pittsburgh Courier reporter George Barbour in background, Liberty Avenue Downtown
